title: Larry Berman's take on the jobs data
description: Larry Berman gives his take on the latest jobs data and the chances of a Trump re-election in the U.S.

title: Canada sees record job losses in April
description: Bloomberg News' Shelly Hagan digs into the latest Canadian jobs data.

title: NEC's Kudlow on U.S. Job Losses, Reopening the Economy and China Trade
description: May.08 -- National Economic Council Director Lawrence Kudlow discusses the April U.S. employment report, reopening the economy and the future of U.S.-China trade relations. He speaks with Bloomberg's Jonathan Ferro on "Bloomberg The Open."

title: Difficult road ahead following employment shock
description: Pattie Lovett-Reid, CTV's chief financial commentator and Frances Donald, chief economist at Manulife Investment Management, discuss the challenges ahead for the millions of Canadians who've lost their jobs. Reid says thousands of jobs may never come back, and many Canadians may have to reinvent themselves.

title: Canadian jobs report is 'devastating': Frances Donald
description: The Canadian economy shed just under two million jobs last month, and while that was far short of estimates, Frances Donald, chief economist at Manulife Investment Management, says it's a "devastating" result. She says it doesn't fully reflect the severity of the economic pain that many Canadians are experiencing.

title: 'Employment is the key factor in loan repayment': Home Capital CEO
description: Home Capital Group CEO Yousry Bissada says that despite putting extra money aside for loan provisions, the company entered the quarter in a strong position and is prepared to weather an extended period of unemployment amid the pandemic.

title: Historic losses expected ahead of jobs report
description: Bloomberg News' Shelly Hagan looks at what to expect from Friday's jobs data release.

title: We should be able to return to 'robust economic growth' and 'full employment': Mark Wiseman
description: Mark Wiseman, former CEO of the Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPPIB) and former investment executive at BlackRock, is quite confident that Canada's economy can bounce back post-pandemic. In the shorter term he does see markets remaining volatile.

title: U.S. April employment report could show 10 million job losses: Strategas chief economist
description: Don Rissmiller, chief economist at Strategas joins BNN Bloomberg to discuss COVID-19's impact on the U.S economy and the American labour market.

title: Can companies force employees to leave work without pay amid the pandemic?
description: Muneeza Sheikh, employment lawyer at Levitt LLP, answers a viewer questions on whether an employer can ask workers to take a mandatory leave of absence during the pandemic.

title: My fear is April will be worse: Macquarie's Doyle on jobs data
description: David Doyle, North American economist and Canadian market strategist at Macquarie Group, joins BNN Bloomberg for his take on the March jobs data.

title: Canada's economy sheds over 1 million jobs in the past month: Chief economist
description: Eric Lascelles, chief economist at RBC Global Asset Management, joins BNN  Bloomberg to break Canada's latest jobs data indicating the loss of over 1 million jobs. Lascelles notes the circumstances are extraordinary and next month's data is expected to reveal even more losses.

title: Australia Passes Record $80 Billion Job-Rescue Package
description: Apr.08 -- Australia’s parliament passed a record A$130 billion ($80 billion) jobs-rescue plan, as the government continues efforts to buttress the economy from the coronavirus outbreak. Paul Allen reports on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia."

title: Alberta premier warns unemployment could reach 25% in the province
description: Alberta Premier Jason Kenney said Tuesday the crisis impacting the global oil industry could cause at least 25 per cent unemployment in the province. BNN Bloomberg's Tara Weber.

title: 'Confident' that the system can handle big load of CERB applications expected: Canada's Employment Minister
description: Today is the day that Canadians who are out of work because of COVID-19 can start applying for the Canada Emergency Response Benefit (CERB). Carla Qualtrough, minister of employment and workforce development discusses what to expect.

title: Jobs growth data ahead of the virus scare
description: Brian DePratto, senior economist at TD Bank Group, digs into the latest Canadian jobs report and explains why there's no celebrating over the stronger-than-anticipated jobs growth.

title: Australia Unemployment Unexpectedly Rose in January
description: Feb.19 -- Australia released its unemployment data for the month of January. Bloomberg Economics’ James McIntyre discusses the data on “Bloomberg Markets: Asia.”

title: Low unemployment, inflation, fuel prices all tailwinds for Walmart: Analyst
description: CFRA senior equity analyst Garrett Nelson joins BNN Bloomberg for his take on Walmart's latest earnings release and the outlook for 2020.

title: Pattie Lovett-Reid: What to consider before saying 'yes' to that job offer
description: As part of BNN Bloomberg's Your Month Month coverage, CTV's Chief Financial Commentator Pattie Lovett-Reid explains how you can assess whether a job is the right fit for you.

title: Powell Says Fed Will Never Declare Victory on Employment Goal
description: Feb.11 -- Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell comments on the Fed's progress towards full employment in response to a question from Representative Ayanna Pressley, a Massachusetts Democrat, during testimony before the House Financial Services Committee.

title: Pattie Lovett-Reid: How to quit your job without burning bridges
description: There may be a point in time when you decide to move on from your current job. But how can you make a graceful exit without burning bridges? CTV's Chief Financial Commentator Pattie Lovett-Reid discusses.

title: Fed's Clarida on Inflation Target, Employment, Yield Curve
description: Jan.31 -- Federal Reserve Vice Chairman Richard Clarida discusses the central bank's efforts to meet its inflation target, labor participation rate, and factors behind the recent yield curve inversion. He speaks with Bloomberg's David Westin on "Balance of Power."

title: Latest Canadian jobs data indicates November report was just a 'blip': Frances Donald
description: Canada had a stronger-than-expected end to 2019, with 35,000 jobs added to the Canadian economy in December. Frances Donald, chief economist and head of macro strategy at Manulife Investment Management joins BNN Bloomberg with her take on the data,

title: Jobs Report Gives Fed More Runway to Cut Rates, Pimco's Wilding Says
description: Jan.10 -- Tiffany Wilding, chief U.S. economist at Pacific Investment Management Co. (Pimco), reacts to the December U.S. employment report and its implications for the economy. She speaks with Bloomberg's Vonnie Quinn and Guy Johnson on "Bloomberg Markets."

title: U.S. saw 'surprising' increase in layoffs in 2019: Staffing firm
description: BNN Bloomberg speaks with Andrew Challenger of Challenger, Gray & Christmas about his latest report on the U.S. job market and layoffs in 2019.

title: Top tips to get hired in today's jobs market
description: Pattie Lovett-Reid has a look at what qualities employers are looking for.

title: Racialized communities struggling to find employment despite willingness to work: Economist
description: Sheila Block, senior economist at the Canadian Centre for Policy Alternatives, joins BNN Bloomberg to discuss their latest report assessing the wage income gap within Canada's racialized communities.

title: Canada shed 71,200 in November
description: Bloomberg Canada’s Managing Editor Dave Scanlan breaks down the shocking jobs number.

title: The biggest drop in Canadian employment since 2009
description: Sherry Cooper, chief economist at Dominion Lending Centres, provides instant analysis of a massive surprise in the latest Canadian employment report. The Canadian economy shed 71,200 jobs in November and unemployment rate spiked higher to 5.5 per cent.

title: German Unemployment Unexpectedly Drops as Optimism Edges Up
description: Nov.29 -- German unemployment unexpectedly dropped this month as a slump in manufacturing showed signs of stabilizing and the trade tensions that have weighed on exporters eased. In a report that’s likely to damp any expectations of fiscal stimulus, the number of people out of work slid by 16,000, compared with estimates for an increase of 6,000. Valentin Marinov, head of G10 FX research and strategy at Credit Agricole, and Mike Bell, global market strategist at JPMorgan Asset Management, discusses the outlook for Europe's largest economy on “Bloomberg Surveillance.”

title: Why parts of the economy could a hit if bond market continues to ratchet up
description: BNN Bloomberg's Greg Bonnell speaks with David Prince of Harbinger Capital Markets Research about what economic and market activity you should be watching.

title: Hot jobs market takes break in October with surprise loss
description: BNN Bloomberg speaks with Sherry Cooper, chief economist at Dominion Lending Centres, about the latest jobs report, which broke a two-month streak of strong jobs growth.

title: Amanda Lang: Should wages be tied to inflation?
description: BNN Bloomberg's Amanda Lang looks at the case for and against tying workers' wages to the inflation rate.

title: Bank of Canada now has less incentive to cut rates in October: Scotiabank
description: Shaun Osborne, chief FX strategist at Scotiabank, joins BNN Bloomberg's Amanda Lang for a look at the upside potential for the Canadian dollar as the latest labour force survey sees another month of resiliency and growth.

title: The link between recession fears and low unemployment
description: Andrew Pyle, senior wealth advisor and portfolio manager at The Pyle Group, Scotia Wealth Management, explains why more and more analysts are honing in on the falling U.S. unemployment rate as a possible trigger for a recession.

title: UniCredit's Nielsen Says He's Willing to Bet Against Kudlow, Sees U.S. Recession Next Year
description: Oct.04 -- Erik Nielsen, UniCredit's global chief economist, discusses the outlook for the U.S. economy with Bloomberg's Guy Johnson on "Bloomberg Markets: "European Close."

title: U.S. employment growth short of estimates
description: Tim Quinlan, senior economist at Wells Fargo Securities, provides instant analysis of the latest U.S. employment report that includes weaker than expected jobs growth.

title: Australia Cuts Key Rate as Global Threats, Unemployment Rise
description: Oct.01 -- Australia's central bank lowered interest rates for the third time this year as it tries to shield the economy from a slew of offshore risks, and signaled it may cut even further. Reserve Bank chief Philip Lowe reduced the cash rate by 25 basis points to 0.75%, as predicted by money markets and most economists, edging closer to a level where unconventional measures may need to be adopted. Raffaele Bertoni, head of debt capital markets and senior portfolio manager at Gulf Investment Corp., discusses the move on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe."

title: Jobs growth the key theme this federal election: Canadian Global Cities Council
description: Jan De Silva, chair at Canadian Global Cities Council, joins BNN Bloomberg for a look at what the coalition of chamber of commerce and board of trade members from Vancouver to Montreal want to see done for businesses in big cities at the national level, specifically on innovation and trade.

title: U.K. May-July Unemployment Falls to 3.8% as Basic Pay Tops Estimates
description: Sep.10 -- Erik Nielsen, chief economist at UniCredit Group, examines the state of the U.K. economy as the May-July unemployment rate falls to 3.8%. He speaks with Bloomberg's Francine Lacqua on "Bloomberg Surveillance."

title: Breaking stigmas as Canada's skilled-trade labour gap grows
description: Mandy Rennehan, CEO of Freshco, joins BNN Bloomberg's Greg Bonnell for a look at the growing skilled trade labour gap and looks at why breaking stigmas of trades jobs is critical to ensure closing that gap.

title: Canada's economy 'running close to capacity': Economist
description: Dawn Desjardins, deputy chief economist at RBC, joins BNN Bloomberg to discuss Canada's strong job gains in the month of August and her current economic outlook.

title: 'Goldilocks' Jobs Report Reinforces Fed Will Cut Rates at Next Meeting, Aviva's Schmidt Says
description: Sep.06 -- Susan Schmidt, Aviva Investors head of U.S. equities, comments on the August U.S. employment report and its implications for the path of Federal Reserve monetary policy. She speaks with Bloomberg's Vonnie Quinn on "Bloomberg Markets."

title: Labour market too healthy for the BoC to cut in October: CIBC's Tal
description: Benjamin Tal, deputy chief economist at CIBC Capital Markets, joins BNN Bloomberg to discuss the latest jobs data and his outlook for the Canadian economy.

title: U.S. jobs report lifts rate cut expectations
description: Stock markets are hanging onto most of the gains from Thursday's big rally after the latest U.S. employment report showed weaker-than-expected job creation. Dan Deming, managing director at KKM Financial, says the report is helping to cement expectations that another rate cut by the Federal Reserve is on its way.

title: U.K. wage growth hits 11-year high
description: The U.K. jobs market is remaining resilient amid ongoing Brexit uncertainty, as wage growth hits an 11-year peak. James Hughes, chief market analyst at AxiTrader, says this is a good sign for the U.K. after the economy shrunk between April and June.

title: Disgruntled gig economy workers look at closing employment loopholes
description: Muneeza Sheikh, employment lawyer at Levitt LLP, joins BNN Bloomberg's Amanda Lang for a look at the challenges that workers in the gig economy face. She also discusses the potential ramifications from growing calls for better working conditions and the growing chorus of workers hoping to unionize.

title: Valuations in China Bonds Has Become Quite Attractive, Says StanChart’s Liu
description: Jul.16 -- Becky Liu, head of China macro strategy at Standard Chartered, discusses the rally in China bonds, China’s debt profile and the job market. She speaks on “Bloomberg Markets: China Open.”

title: How Deutsche Bank Job Cuts Impact the Banking Employment Landscape
description: Jul.08 -- Noah Schwarz, senior client partner at Korn Ferry, examines the state of hiring and employment in the banking industry as Deutsche Bank AG plans to cuts 18,000 employees. He speaks on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."

title: Strong jobs data could see the Fed turn more hawkish: Economist
description: Stéfane Marion, chief economist and strategist at National Bank Financial, joins BNN Bloomberg for a look at the U.S. and Canadian jobs data. He says that while Canada's appear weak for the month, it remains a "red-hot" market.
